get.description:
Returns the devices associated with a user.

Bridge devices have `type=1`. Sensor devices have `type=2`.

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Which field to sort devices on

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Which direction to sort devices on

parameters.name: list_shared
parameters.description: Determines whether to include devices that have granted shared access to user

parameters.name: primary_location
parameters.description: Only include devices associated to a primary location if true. Exclude devices associated to a primary location if false.

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: Find devices associated to a specified location ID

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter devices by their type (Bridge: 1, Water Sensor: 2)

post.description: Ask a device questions about its water usage. See [Querying Samples](https://flumetech.readme.io/v1.0/docs/querying-samples) for detailed info. The "Content-Type" header must be set to "application/json".

queries.description: Array of questions to ask. See [Querying Samples](https://flumetech.readme.io/v1.0/docs/querying-samples) for detailed info

operation.description: The optional type of aggregate/accumulate operation to perform. Options are SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX, CNT

sort_direction.description: Ascending and descending supported. Which way to sort the results.

units.description: The unit of measurement to return the water usage data by. Options are GALLONS, LITERS, CUBIC_FEET, and CUBIC_METERS.

types.description: List of water types to include in the output. The "all" type returns total usage using the "value" field in each output object. Other values can be found in Water Types, and appear in the "types" field in each output object.

Result.value:

  "detailed": null,

  "pagination": null
}

code-samples.name: Node

code-samples.code:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.flumetech.com/users/user_id/devices/device_id/query")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["content-type"] = 'application/json'
request["authorization"] = 'Bearer token'
request.body = "{ \"queries\": [{ \"request_id\": \"abc\", \"bucket\": \"MON\", \"since_datetime\": \"2016-04-04 01:00:00\", \"group_multiplier\": 3 }, { \"request_id\": \"xyz\", \"bucket\": \"DAY\", \"since_datetime\": \"2016-04-04 01:00:00\", \"until_datetime\": \"2016-04-07 01:00:00\" }] }"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

get.description: Fetch all devices the current user is subscribed to.

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Which field to sort the subscriptions on

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: The direction to sort the subscriptions on

parameters.name: alert_type
parameters.description: Only return subscriptions with this alert type

parameters.name: notification_types
parameters.description: Only return subscriptions that subscribe to the exact bitmask of notification types

parameters.name: notification_type
parameters.description: 1(LEAK), 2 (Budget), 4 (General). Return all subscriptions that contains the bit. Example: 1 would return notification_types 1, 3, 5 and 7

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Only return subscriptions that are for this device

parameters.name: device_type
parameters.description: Only return subscriptions for devices of this type

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: Only return subscriptions that are associated to a device at this location

post.description: Returns the access and refresh tokens for a user of the API. If user didn't finish signing up, it will return a 403 error. To retrieve the `user_id`, the JWT token needs to be decoded. The "Content-Type" header must be set to "application/json". See the Authentication page for more info.

parameters.name: envelope
parameters.description: Whether to envelope the token response in Flume's custom formatting.

username.description: Email address of user attempting to login.

password.description: Password of user attempting to login.

get.description: Fetch all usage alerts from devices owned by the user.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: How many usage alerts to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of usage alerts to return

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Which field to sort usage alerts on

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Which direction to sort usage alerts on

parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Return usage alerts created for the device with this specific device_id

parameters.name: flume_leak
parameters.description: Returns usage alerts that were determined to be leaks by the Flume Smart Leak Rule.
